Job DescriptionThe Principal Data Engineer - Manufacturing Analytics is responsible to enhance efficiencies for the implementation of TIBCO Spotfire and Statistica to make the user experience seamless. The Manager will be responsible to work on improving implementation of processes and work with data source system owners to develop/better existing interfaces to TIBCO Statistica and Spotfire. The Manager will also be responsible to develop configurations in OSIPI and support integrations to OSIPI. This is a remote eligible position.Key Duties & ResponsibilitiesSubject Matter Expert for TIBCO Data Science (Statistica) and TIBCO Spotfire Subject Matter Expert for OSIPI/working with data from OSIPI Previous experience with developing best practices for software implementations Develop and implement technical solutions in TIBCO Data Science, TIBCO Spotfire and OSIPI Coordinate and partner with Data Technology & Engineering (DTE) and MPID on new system implementations, system enhancements and changes. Work cross functionally with various groups within Commercial Manufacturing and Supply Chain (CMSC) group and other groups to develop novel solutions that will help making manufacturing process improvements. Assess and design of a phased approach in project plans based on readiness of peripheral systems, design and build of process models. Develop automated testing methodologies and lead validation efforts to implement solutions in a GxP environment. Work with various groups to develop and maintain a data dictionary for all the systems that are owned by Manufacturing Process Intelligence & Data Team Required Knowledge/SkillsDemonstrated experience in implementing projects in the pharmaceutical industry. Familiarity with GxP regulations and approaches to System Development Life Cycles (SDLC) Work experience must include some of the following: Manufacturing Systems Development/Configuration Preferably TIBCO Statistica, TIBCO Spotfire and OSIPI Development of solutions to perform predictive modeling in a manufacturing/clinical environment. Implementation of manufacturing systems solutions Proficient in MATLAB, VB Scripting, JavaScript, PowerShell, SQL Experience working on developing machine learning and artificial intelligence models Demonstrated ability to collaborate with multiple cross functional areas Demonstrated excellence in project management and managing, tracking, and measuring project progress. Proficient with use of our data source software systems (e.g., OSIPI, LIMS, Snowflake, Oracle) Education And ExperienceTypically requires a PhD in chemical engineering, computer sciences or related field and 2+ years experience in life sciences, engineering or academia, orTypically requires a Master's Degree in chemical engineering, computer sciences or related field and 3+ years experience in life sciences, engineering or academia, orTypically requires a Bachelor's Degree in chemical engineering, computer sciences or related field and 5+ years experience in life sciences, engineering or academiaExperience in manufacturing systems development and implementation requiredSalary range: $108,000 - $162,000 annuallyDisclosure StatementThe range provided is based on what we believe is a reasonable estimate for the base salary pay range for this job at the time of posting. This role is eligible for an annual bonus and annual equity awards. Some roles may also be eligible for overtime pay, in accordance with federal and state requirements. Actual base salary pay will be based on a number of factors, including skills, competencies, experience, and other job-related factors permitted by law. At Vertex, our Total Rewards offerings also include inclusive market-leading benefits to meet our employees wherever they are in their career, financial, family and wellbeing journey while providing flexibility and resources to support their growth and aspirations. From medical, dental and vision benefits to generous paid time off (including a week-long company shutdown in the Summer and the Winter), educational assistance programs including student loan repayment, a generous commuting subsidy, matching charitable donations, 401(k) and so much more.Company InformationVertex is a global biotechnology company that invests in scientific innovation.Vertex is committed to equal employment opportunity and non-discrimination for all employees and qualified applicants without regard to a person's race, color, sex, gender identity or expression, age, religion, national origin, ancestry, ethnicity, disability, veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, marital status, or any characteristic protected under applicable law. Vertex is an E-Verify Employer in the United States. Vertex will make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with known disabilities, in accordance with applicable law.Any applicant requiring an accommodation in connection with the hiring process and/or to perform the essential functions of the position for which the applicant has applied should make a request to the recruiter or hiring manager, or contact Talent Acquisition at ApplicationAssistance@vrtx.com.
